Article Summary: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that the announcement of the Unified Pension Scheme signifies another “U-turn” by the Modi administration. The new pension scheme guarantees a minimum pension of Rs 10,000 per month upon retirement after at least 10 years of service. Initially, it will benefit 23 lakh central government employees.

Article Title: 'Bahut kuch hai': CBI on evidence in corruption case against RG Kar Medical College ex-principal Sandip Ghosh
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has ramped up its probe into the alleged rape and murder of a postgraduate trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College in Kolkata. On Sunday, CBI officials carried out extensive search operations at the residences and offices of former principal Sandip Ghosh , ex-MSVP Sanjay Vashisth, and 13 others across Kolkata.The agency is also investigating possible financial irregularities at the institute, particularly in the procurement of materials for patient care.As part of the investigation, Sanjay Roy, the main accused in the rape and murder case, underwent a lie detection test at Presidency Jail, Kolkata. Two other individuals are also scheduled for similar tests at the CBI office later today. While the results cannot be used as trial evidence, they are expected to guide further investigative actions. On Saturday, four people, including Sandip Ghosh, were subjected to polygraph tests, with the CBI seeking court permission to test a total of seven individuals.While the CBI Anti-Corruption Branch continued its investigation a CBI official when asked about evidence in the case said, “Bahut kuch hai” (There is a lot).CBI registered an FIR against Dr Sandip Ghosh on Saturday, following the orders of the Calcutta High Court. The court's single bench had instructed the CBI to investigate the alleged corruption at the medical college.The CBI was given a deadline of three weeks by the Calcutta High Court to provide an update on the progress of the investigation. The report is expected to be submitted on September 17.The Supreme Court, while hearing the suo motu case regarding the rape and murder of the trainee doctor, directed on Tuesday that the security of RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata be transferred to the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF).The incident, which occurred on August 9, involved the alleged rape and murder of a postgraduate trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital. It led to the arrest of a Kolkata Police civic volunteer and sparked widespread protests by doctors and citizens. The Calcutta High Court subsequently directed the CBI to investigate both the murder and the financial irregularities at the institution.
Article Summary: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has ramped up its probe into the alleged rape and murder of a postgraduate trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College in Kolkata. The agency is also investigating possible financial irregularities at the institute, particularly in the procurement of materials for patient care.

Article Title: TISS 1st year student found dead night after party
Article Text: NEW DELHI: A 28-year-old student of Tata Institute of Social Sciences was found dead in his rented apartment on Sunday. The Human Resource student, Anurag Jaiswal , was reportedly heavily intoxicated and had attended a party with 125 people the night before.Officials said that when he did not wake up in the morning, he was taken to a local hospital in Chembur , where he was declared dead on arrival.The authorities suspect possible ragging and the matter is under investigation. All of Jaiswal's friends are being questioned.
Article Summary: Anurag Jaiswal was reportedly heavily intoxicated and had attended a party with 125 people the night before. He was taken to a local hospital in Chembur where he was declared dead on arrival. Authorities suspect possible ragging and the matter is under investigation.

Article Title: Plastic in parantha: IRCTC imposes Rs 10 lakh fine on Dehradun Shatabdi caterer
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation ( IRCTC ) on Sunday imposed a fine of Rs 10 lakh on a caterer of Dehradun Shatabdi train after a plastic wire was found in parantha served to a passenger.The Railway body further informed that an officer had been deputed to "thoroughly audit the Base kitchen" and also check the supply of branded stocks.The base kitchen has been shut down for the time being, it said.In a statement dated August 24, the IRCTC informed that a passenger spotted a plastic wire in his parantha. The waiter, however, apologized and offered a replacement.The statement also noted that hand sanitizer and tissues were not given to the passengers and the quality of the food needed improvement.
Article Summary: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation ( IRCTC ) imposed a fine of Rs 10 lakh on a caterer of Dehradun Shatabdi train. The Railway body further informed that an officer had been deputed to "thoroughly audit the Base kitchen"

Article Title: 'Don't field candidates ... ': Omar Abdullah takes dig at Mehbooba Mufti's 'proposal' for J&K polls
Article Text: NEW DELHI: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Sunday took a shot at People's Democratic Party leader Mehbooba Mufti on her proposal to support the National Conference and Congress alliance in the upcoming J&K assembly elections, if they agree upon her party's agenda. Abdullah asked Mehbooba to not field candidates against NC-Congress as their agenda is the same.During his address in Kashmir's Ganderbal district, former J&K chief minister said, "They (PDP) said if the NC-Congress alliance accepts their agenda, they will not put up candidates.You have put all our agenda in your manifesto. You have already accepted our agenda and now there is not much of a difference between your agenda and our agenda. Then do not field candidates and come, we will build a better tomorrow for Jammu and Kashmir."Abdullah said his party promised to provide 200 free units of electricity if it comes to power and "they (PDP) also said they will provide 200 units"."We said we will provide one lakh government jobs in the first year, they also put that in their manifesto. We talked about reopening (cross-LoC) routes, it is in their manifesto as well. We talked about keeping the doors of dialogue open and they also said so. Almost everything that my colleagues put in our manifesto, they also put it," he said.This comes a day after Mehbooba said that she would extend her support to their alliance and would not contest for any seat, if the National Conference and Congress agree upon the agenda of solving the issue of Jammu and Kashmir."Alliance and seat sharing are faraway things. If the National Conference and Congress are ready to adopt our agenda, we will say they should contest all seats, we will follow them because for me solving the problem of Kashmir is more important than anything else. When we allied earlier also, we had an agenda, when we allied with the BJP, we had an agenda that they agreed to but the alliance between the National Conference and Congress is not happening on the agenda, it is happening on seat sharing," she said."We will not do any alliance in which there is only talk of seat sharing. The alliance should be on the agenda and our agenda is to solve the problem of Jammu and Kashmir," she added.Polls in Jammu and Kashmir will be held in three phases. The first phase will be held on September 18, second phase on September 25, and third phase on October 1. The results will be declared on October 4.Out of the total 90 assembly constituency seats, 24 will go to polls in phase 1, 26 in phase 2 and 40 in phase 3.
Article Summary: Abdullah asked Mehbooba to not field candidates against NC-Congress as their agenda is the same. He said his party promised to provide 200 free units of electricity if it comes to power and "they (PDP) also said they will provide 200 units" PDP leader said she would extend her support to their alliance and would not contest for any seat.

Article Title: Several hundreds evacuated amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat: Key points
Article Text:
Recorded highest rainfall

Directed to take necessary steps ensuring safety

Reservoirs on high alert

Average annual rainfall so far

IMD predicted heavy rainfall, red alerts

NEW DELHI: Heavy rains over the weekend caused widespread flooding across Gujarat , blocking state highways and village roads, the continuous downpour over the past 48 hours inundated low-lying areas, disrupted daily life and hindered traffic flow, officials said.Several hundred people were evacuated and moved to safer locations from the districts of Valsad and Navsari as heavy rainfall battered southern Gujarat on Saturday and Sunday, officials added.According to the State Emergency Operation Centre , Vapi taluka in Valsad district experienced the highest rainfall in Gujarat, with 326 millimeters recorded in a 24-hour period until 6 am on Sunday. Khergam in Navsari also received significant rainfall, measuring 248 mm since 6 am.The heavy rains have severely impacted several districts, including Valsad, Surat, Tapi, Navsari and Narmada, as per official reports. As a precautionary measure, over 600 individuals living in low-lying areas of Valsad were evacuated to safer locations due to the heavy downpour.Chief minister Bhupendra Patel , in telephonic conversations with district collectors from the rain-affected areas, directed them to take all necessary steps to provide relief to residents, including timely evacuations and ensuring the safety of livestock.The chief minister said that State and National Disaster Response Forces (SDRF and NDRF) teams were deployed and ready to assist as needed. Due to ongoing rainfall in the catchment areas, the water level of the Sardar Sarovar Narmada dam rose sharply, reaching 135.30 meters on Sunday, just a few meters below its full capacity of 138.68 meters, officials reported.Executive Magistrate (Disaster), Navsari AM Gamit said: "A total of 17 persons were shifted to Bilimora city after flooding in low-lying areas. The administration is also keeping a close watch on rising water levels of Purna and Kaveri rivers.”According to SSNNL officials , the dam reservoir was receiving 2,65,748 cusecs of water from upstream, leading to the opening of 15 radial gates to manage the discharge."While 1,75,000 cusecs water was flowing out through the gates, 36,975 cusecs water was being released into the river from the riverbed powerhouse and 23,081 cusecs from canal head powerhouse," an SSNNL official added.As of Sunday, Gujarat's 206 reservoirs contained a total of 3.64 lakh million cubic feet of water, which accounts for 65 percent of their overall storage capacity, according to officials. Among these reservoirs, 72 were put on high alert, while 15 were put on alert due to a significant increase in their water levels.This season, Gujarat has received 81.81 per cent of its average annual rainfall. The southern region of the state has received 97.52 per cent, followed by Kutch at 90.18 per cent and Saurashtra at 84.92 per cent.However, data from the SEOC indicates that the northern and east-central regions of Gujarat have experienced lower rainfall compared to the southern part and Saurashtra-Kutch, while north Gujarat has received 64.91 percent of its average annual rainfall so far, while east-central Gujarat has recorded 68.84 percent.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted intense rainfall in several regions of Gujarat until Tuesday morning. According to the forecast, districts in south Gujarat, including Vadodara, Surat, Bharuch, Navsari, and Valsad, along with Amreli and Bhavnagar in the Saurashtra region, are expected to experience 'heavy to very heavy' rain, with isolated 'extremely heavy' rain.Furthermore, the IMD has also forecasted 'heavy to very heavy' rain accompanied by isolated 'extremely heavy' rain in the districts of Anand, Rajkot, Jamnagar, Porbandar, Morbi, Dwarka, and Kutch on Tuesday.IMD had issued a red alert, cautioning that "extremely heavy rainfall may occur" in the state on Sunday.In addition to Gujarat, the IMD has also issued red alerts for various other regions across the country. These include East Rajasthan, West Madhya Pradesh, Konkan and Goa, Central Maharashtra, and the North-Eastern states of Nagaland, Mizoram, Manipur, and Tripura.
Article Summary: Vapi taluka in Valsad district experienced the highest rainfall in Gujarat, with 326 millimeters recorded in a 24-hour period until 6 am on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted intense rainfall in several regions of Gujarat until Tuesday morning.

Article Title: Hema committee report: Kerala govt forms special team to probe atrocities on women in film industry
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Kerala government on Sunday formed a special team to investigate the atrocities faced by women in Malayalam film industry after the Hema committee report brought to light the details of sexual exploitations.This came after Congress leader Chennithala accused the Pinarayi Vijayan government of not taking any action into the matter."After the publication of the Hema Committee report, the film industry in Kerala is under cloud.I don't think that everyone working in the film field is guilty but from the inaction by the Kerala government for 4 years, it is very clear that they want to hide something and protect some people involved in it," Chennithala told ANI."My request to the state government is to go ahead with an inquiry. After the revelation of this report, the government wanted to cover up the whole issue. As opposition, we demand to constitute an SIT and probe the whole issue," he added.The 235-page report, compiled from testimonies by 51 industry professionals, has exposed issues of exploitation in the Malayalam film industry, including the presence of casting couches and poor working conditions for women.It further reveals that the Malayalam film industry is dominated by 10 to 15 male producers, directors, and actors who hold significant control over the sector.
Article Summary: Kerala government forms a special team to investigate the atrocities faced by women in Malayalam film industry. Congress leader Chennithala accused the Pinarayi Vijayan government of not taking any action into the matter. Hema committee report brought to light the details of sexual exploitations.

Article Title: Assam minor gang rape: Congress targets BJP-led government; Himanta defends with data as protests rock state
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The alleged gang rape of a minor in Assam's Nagaon has sparked widespread public outrage across the state, with demands for stringent punishment for the culprits.A protest march was held in Dhing demanding the arrest of the remaining suspects and exemplary punishment for them. A rally was also organised in Gossaigaon, Kokrajhar district, and demonstrations took place in Sivasagar.Congress leader and MP Gourav Gogoi supported the protests and accused the BJP-led government of weakening law and order in the state.He further demanded that the state government take responsibility for the rising incidents of crime against women."The society is angry and agitated because of the crime committed against a minor girl in Nagaon. The girl is being treated in the hospital, and I urge the staff and doctors to ensure she receives proper care. We stand with her family, and the people of Nagaon demand the harshest punishment for the perpetrators," Gogoi said."These incidents keep happening in Assam, and the state government must take responsibility. Women are not safe, and it is clear that the law and order system in Assam has become significantly weak," he added.Meanwhile, Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma defended his government's efforts to ensure women's safety by presenting data showing that the BJP government has registered more rape cases than its predecessors.Taking to X, Sarma said, "Every single incident of rape must be unequivocally condemned, as it represents a grave violation of human dignity. It is our collective responsibility to work towards eliminating this heinous crime from society.""The chart above reflects our ongoing efforts and commitment to creating a safer and more just environment for everyone, especially our women. Let us unite to ensure that such atrocities find no place in our world and that safety, justice, and compassion prevail," he added.A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by three men who came on a motorcycle and surrounded her while she was returning home from tuition on her bicycle in Dhing on Thursday evening.The prime accused, who was arrested on Friday, allegedly escaped from custody, jumped into a pond, and died on Saturday morning, police said.The other two suspects are still at large, and a search for them is ongoing.
Article Summary: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by three men who came on a motorcycle and surrounded her while she was returning home from tuition on her bicycle in Dhing. The prime accused, who was arrested on Friday, allegedly escaped from custody, jumped into a pond, and died on Saturday morning. The other two suspects are still at large, and a search for them is ongoing.

Article Title: 'Ready to contest tomorrow': BJP leader on his party's Haryana poll postponement request
Article Text: NEW DELHI: A day after the Haryana unit of Bhartiya Janta Party requested the Election Commission to defer the state assembly elections, the saffron party leader Anil Vij offered clarification on Sunday saying that the party was ok with preponing the poll dates as well.He added that the party was ready to contest polls even if it was held tomorrow after Congress called it "nervous" for the upcoming elections.The BJP had said cited holidays before and after the election date which could potentially lead to a lower voter turnout in the state.Doubling down on this, Vij told reporters, "The declared dates make it possible for people to take extended holidays, which reduces voter turnout. Congress has reacted today, but we are not just asking for an extension. We suggest moving the dates back by a few days to prevent a long holiday period."BJP on Saturday said, "We have reasoned that the Assembly election date of October 1 is preceded by a holiday on the weekend and followed by some holidays, which may hit the voting percentage as people tend to go on vacation on long weekends that are followed by holidays."Responding to this, the grand old party said, "Seeing its defeat in front, the ruling party is giving childish arguments. Because it has no issue, no work or achievement to tell the public and no 90 candidates to give tickets to. That is why BJP is conspiring to postpone the elections by making an excuse of holidays."The Election Commission on August 16 announced that the Haryana assembly elections will take place in a single phase on October 1, with the results scheduled to be declared on October 4. The BJP is aiming for a third consecutive term, while the Congress is seeking to reclaim power from the ruling party.
Article Summary: BJP had said cited holidays before and after the election date which could potentially lead to a lower voter turnout in the state. The Election Commission on August 16 announced that the Haryana assembly elections will take place in a single phase on October 1, with the results scheduled to be declared on October 4.

Article Title: 'Bound to happen but ... ': BJP hits out at Rahul Gandhi over his caste remarks
Article Text:
'Shedding crocodile tears'

'Shows the poor thinking of Rahul Gandhi'

NEW DELHI: Union minister Giriraj Singh on Sunday said that a caste census is unavoidable and will be carried out by Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the right time. The Union Minister questioned why Rahul Gandhi continued to demand a national caste census when the Congress government in Karnataka is yet to release the results of the caste census conducted in the state."Rahul Gandhi stays away from ground reality and does politics of perception. Caste census has been done in Karnataka, yet the Congress government there has not declared it. When it's time for the country, PM Modi will get it done," Giriraj Singh said.During an event in Prayagraj on Saturday, Rahul Gandhi had claimed that around 90% of the population remains disconnected from the system, despite possessing the necessary skills and talents, which is the reason behind the demand for a caste census.“90% of the people are not a part of the system. They have the required skill, talent but they are not connected with the system. That's why we are demanding a caste census. BJP leaders are saying that an OBC section will be given after the caste census,” Rahul had said.Singh continued his attack on Rahul Gandhi, claiming that he was out of touch with his own identity and incapable of fulfilling promises made to the backward communities. "Rahul Gandhi, who cannot tell his religion or caste, cannot declare the caste census done in Karnataka. Only Modi will ensure benefits to the backward and extremely backward communities, not Rahul Gandhi's perception of politics," the Union minister said.Union minister Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh accused Rahul Gandhi of shedding "crocodile tears" over the caste census issue. Lalan Singh alleged that Gandhi's concern was not genuine, and said that when Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar carried out a caste census, Rahul did not support it."Rahul Gandhi is very concerned about the caste census. When Nitish Kumar conducted the census in Bihar and at that time we were in INDIA, then 2 meetings were held, we said that a resolution should be passed on the caste census. But he did not pass the resolution under pressure from Mamata Banerjee. Today he is shedding crocodile tears. When we got the census done, has Rahul Gandhi ever praised it in Bihar to date? He is just giving a slogan to confuse the public," he said.BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya slammed Rahul Gandhi's remarks about the Miss India list, which Gandhi claimed did not include any Dalit, Adivasi (tribal), or OBC women. Malviya said that these comments reflect the childish mentality of the Leader of the Opposition. According to Malviya, Gandhi's remarks suggest a form of discriminatory attitude that implies women from SC/ST/OBC backgrounds are unable to succeed in beauty pageants like Miss India."It is understandable that a 54 year old middle aged person is going through the list of Miss India. But it is not understandable that he is looking for caste in it. This childish mentality shows the poor thinking of Rahul Gandhi. A kind of perverse sexism according to which girls of SC/ST/OBC community cannot move forward in competitions like Miss India," Malviya said in a post on X."Those Congress workers who were sitting in front and whistling and enjoying themselves like ruffians were more foolish than Rahul Gandhi who failed for the third time," the post added.Rahul while speaking at the 'Samvidhan Samman Sammelan' in Prayagraj had said, "I have checked the list of Miss India, which did not have any Dalit, Adivasi (tribal) or OBC women. Some will talk about cricket or Bollywood. No one will show the cobbler or plumber. Even top anchors in the media are not from the 90%."
Article Summary: Giriraj Singh said that a caste census is unavoidable and will be carried out by Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the right time. Singh continued his attack on Rahul Gandhi, claiming that he was out of touch with his own identity and incapable of fulfilling promises made to the backward communities.

Article Title: Jan Suraaj to contest on all 243 seats in Bihar, 40 candidates to be women: Prashant Kishore
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishore on Sunday announced that his party will contest on all 243 seats in Bihar assembly elections , scheduled in 2025.Poll strategist-turned-politician Kishore also said that his party will field 40 female candidates."Jan Suraaj is fighting on 243 seats in 2025. At least 40 female candidates will be there. In 2030, at least 70-80 female candidates will be there.Till the time females will become economically independent, they cannot get equality. The females should get loan on 4 pc for earning their livelihood," Kishore said."It should be given on government guarantee. When our govt will be formed, people will not have to migrate from Bihar for low income. I urge people to vote not just by seeing the leaders' sons or daughters but by seeing their sons and daughters," he added.Meanwhile, Kishore also ridiculed RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's recent criticism of Nitish Kumar-led Bihar Government and claimed it was laughable."Comments can be made if Tejashwi Yadav speaks on caste, extortion, liquor mafia, crime but if Tejashwi Yadav discusses development model, it is laughable. They have been in power for the last 15 years, he does not know what GDP and GDP growth are, and is talking about the development story of Bihar," he said."As far as crime is concerned, when Tejwashwi Yadav was the Deputy CM six months ago, Bihar was Switzerland for him and after six months Bihar has become a gutter. If today Nitish Kumar joins Mahagathbandhan, Bihar will again start looking great to him," he added.Prashant Kishor is set to launch his new party, Jan Suraaj, on October 2, the 155th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi. This party will emerge from Jan Suraaj Abhiyan, which has been mainly focused on Bihar.To prepare for the launch, eight state-level meetings are being held across Bihar, involving more than 150,000 officials connected with the campaign. These meetings will address the party's formation, leadership, constitution, and key priorities.
Article Summary: Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishore announced that his party will contest on all 243 seats in Bihar assembly elections scheduled in 2025. He also ridiculed RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's recent criticism of Nitish Kumar-led Bihar Government and claimed it was laughable.

Article Title: 'Space reforms benefited youth'
Article Text: PM Narendra Modi , in the 113th episode of his monthly radio address ' Mann Ki Baat ', praised the advancements in the country's space sector and said Indian youth have vastly benefited from space sector reforms. "A lot is happening in 21st-century India, which is strengthening the foundation of Viksit Bharat . For example, on Aug 23, all the countrymen celebrated the first National Space Day .Once again, you all must have celebrated the success of Chandrayaan-3. Last year, on this day, Chandrayaan-3 landed at the Shiv-Shakti point on the moon's southern hemisphere, making India the first country to achieve this feat," the PM said.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi praised the advancements in the country's space sector. He said Indian youth have vastly benefited from space sector reforms. "A lot is happening in 21st-century India, which is strengthening the foundation of Viksit Bharat," he said.

Article Title: Making India drug-free by 2047 now every citizen's vow: Amit Shah
Article Text: RAIPUR: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's resolve of a drug-free India is now becoming the vow of every citizen of the country, Union home minister Amit Shah said in Raipur on Sunday.Illegal trade of narcotics is a threat to the nation, and the money earned from this crime is used to promote terrorism and Naxalism, and to weaken the nation's economy, the home minister said.Ordering a ruthless crackdown, Shah instructed officials to seize the properties of drug dealers without hesitation. "Unless we demolish the entire network or chain, we cannot control the illegal trade of narcotics. It's an international problem. In India, we need to create more awareness and fight against it. I would say some nations have lost the battle against the illegal trade of narcotics. We need to use scientific methods in the investigation," Shah said after virtually inaugurating the regional office of Narcotics Control Bureau in Raipur.E-commerce platforms are being used for drug trafficking , and drones are being used to deliver drugs, he said, adding Bengal, Odisha and Andhra Pradesh have become transit routes for Ganja smuggling. Those who consume drugs are victims of the system, while those who trade in drugs are criminals, Shah said, adding narcotics not only destroys youths' lives but also poses a threat to national security.He then cited Modi's resolve to make the nation free from addiction by 2047 when India will celebrate "Azadi Ka Shatabdi Samaroh", adding a coordinated effort was required to achieve this goal.Shah said the trend of drug trafficking is changing from natural to synthetic drugs that are available in small quantities but are "expensive and more harmful than natural drugs".In Chhattisgarh, sedative use has been reported more than the national average at 1.45%, he said, pointing out that since Chhattisgarh shares a boundary with seven states, it makes the challenge tougher. Chhattisgarh reported 'ganja' consumption at over 4.9%, which is much higher than the national average of 2.8%, the home minister said, calling it a concern for the state.
Article Summary: Illegal trade of narcotics is a threat to the nation, Amit Shah says. Money earned from this crime is used to promote terrorism and Naxalism. Chhattisgarh reported 'ganja' consumption at over 4.9%, much higher than national average.

Article Title: Youths: Modi encourages youths without political background to join politics
Article Text:
We also published the following articles recently

'Youngsters without political background ...': Top quotes from PM Modi's 'Mann ki Baat' address

In his 'Mann ki Baat' address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi discussed India's progress toward a 'Viksit Bharat' and highlighted the positive response to his call for young people to join politics. He noted the celebration of National Space Day, the success of Chandrayaan-3, and emphasized initiatives such as toy recycling, children's nutrition, and the upcoming Paralympics in Paris.

Have embarked on new political journey, need support: Champai

Champai Soren, a senior JMM leader, announced a new political journey by forming a new party after feeling disrespected by JMM. The 64-year-old veteran politician will tour Kolhan's 14 assembly constituencies to connect with voters and explain his decision. Despite his move, Champai has not resigned from his current party or ministerial post.

Future of Bangladesh's textile industry amidst political uncertainty

Bangladesh's textile industry, a significant contributor to GDP and employment, faces uncertainty following Sheikh Hasina's ouster. Her tenure saw infrastructure improvements, special economic zones, and labour reforms that boosted exports. Political instability now threatens foreign investment, trade relations, and labour peace, raising concerns about the industry's future resilience and growth.

NEW DELHI: Expressing satisfaction over the response to his recent exhortation from Red Fort to connect over one lakh youth without a political pedigree with politics, PM Narendra Modi , in his monthly radio talk ‘Mann Ki Baat’ on Sunday said a large number of youth, keen to join politics, were looking for the right opportunity and guidance.“I have also received letters from youth across the country on this subject.Enormous response is being received on social media as well. People have sent me many kinds of suggestions. Some youth have written in their letters that it is truly inconceivable for them. On account of the absence of a political legacy on the part of their grandfather or parents they could not enter politics despite wanting to join,” the PM said.Citing a few responses to his Red Fort call, Modi said some youth had written that they possessed good experience working at the ground level and, hence, they could help solve people’s problems.“Some youth have also written that dynastic politics crushes new talent. Some youth have mentioned that such efforts will lend more strength to our democracy. I thank everyone for sending in suggestions on the subject. I hope that now with our collective efforts, youth who do not possess a political background will also be able to come forward in politics... their experience and their fervour will prove useful for the country,” Modi said.He recalled the freedom movement and said many people without a political background had come forward and took the plunge for the sake of India’s freedom. “Once more, we require the same spirit to attain the goal of Viksit Bharat. I shall urge all my young friends to positively join this campaign. This step of yours will be transformative in terms of your future and the country’s future,” the PM said.He also hailed people for the success of ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and said when people join hands to express a sentiment, it lends unparalleled glory to any campaign.
Article Summary: PM Modi discussed India's progress toward a 'Viksit Bharat' and highlighted the positive response to his call for young people to join politics. He noted the celebration of National Space Day, the success of Chandrayaan-3 and emphasized initiatives such as toy recycling.

Article Title: Trader gets life for killing sister's 'rapist'
Article Text: A Karnataka court sentenced a trader to life for killing one of five men suspected of raping his 14-year-old sister in 2013. He stabbed the accused multiple times at a market in 2015.
Article Summary: A Karnataka court sentenced a trader to life for killing one of five men suspected of raping his 14-year-old sister in 2013. He stabbed the accused multiple times at a market in 2015. He was sentenced to life in prison.

Article Title: Maharashtra becomes 1st state to offer Unified Pension Scheme to employees
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Hours after central government employees ' organisations demanded that state governments implement the Unified Pension Scheme ( UPS ), poll-bound Maharashtra on Sunday became the first state to offer a switch to its employees amid expectation that others, especially those governed by NDA, will follow suit.The decision came 24 hours after Union cabinet approved UPS to offer 50% of an employee's average salary for the last 12 months as pension, along with inflation adjustment and other sweeteners to address the demands of govt employees who joined in 2004 and later.While 23 lakh central govt employees stand to benefit from Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), the number may rise to 90 lakh if all states offer it. Urging states to implement the scheme, top representatives of central govt employees said political parties should not politicise the issue. Though they said OPS is the best option as it did not require employees to make any contribution, they are satisfied with UPS.“We should be practical to see what best we can get and govt can provide. UPS incorporates 90% of the provisions of OPS and so we are happy. Govt is working on a lump sum amount that employees covered by UPS will get at the time of their retirement from their monthly contribution,” said Shiv Gopal Mishra of All India Railwaymen’s Federation and secretary (staff side) of national council of JCM.Mishra said in the current scenario, nothing could be a better solution than UPS. He said since state govt employees and their associations are also part of the agitation to get a fair deal for all those recruited from Jan 2004 onwards, they will also pursue state governments to implement this quickly.Cabinet secretary-designate T V Somanathan, who headed the panel to review NPS & held negotiations with staff organisations, said on Saturday that Centre’s UPS template can be replicated by states. He had said that over 99% of the employees covered under NPS would find it beneficial to shift to UPS.JCM chief M Raghavaiah said staff body expected more states to implement UPS and urged Centre and the states to guarantee pension of 50% of the salary for those who have served 20 years in place of 25 years. He said the lump sum amount to be paid at the time of retirement should be one-fourth of monthly pay of past six months.Sources said UPS will benefit over eight lakh railways employees who have joined service in past 20 years. “Welfare of govt employees should be an issue of ‘they vs us’ for political parties as we work for organisations irrespective of which party is in power,” said a senior representative when asked about Congress taking potshots at BJP.
Article Summary: Poll-bound Maharashtra on Sunday became the first state to offer a switch to its employees amid expectation that others, especially those governed by NDA, will follow suit. The decision came 24 hours after Union cabinet approved UPS to offer 50% of an employee's average salary for the last 12 months as pension.

Article Title: Need to further empower women to fulfil Viksit Bharat dreams: PM Modi
Article Text: JALGAON: Crimes against women are "unpardonable," PM Narendra PM Modi asserted Sunday and urged every state govt to take strict action."The security of women is very important... Not only must the culprit be sternly punished for committing such crimes, but all those who try to protect them must be dealt with an iron hand," he said at a ' Lakhpati Didi ' convention in north Maharashtra's Jalgaon.Although he didn't refer to any specific case, his remarks hold weight following the recent rape-murder of a PG resident doctor in Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and the rape of two minor girls in Badlapur. Both sparked nationwide outrage.PM Modi expressed his empathy for the anger and pain felt by women across the country. He warned that police, doctors, and school representatives protecting culprits should not be spared.A message must go from top to bottom that such acts ( crime against women ) will not be tolerated, PM Modi said. He also underlined the responsibility of state govts, political parties and society to prevent crimes against women.“Govts will come and go but crime against women must be tackled with an iron hand at all costs,” he said. He assured that Centre is ready to support state govts in addressing such crimes.PM PM Modi highlighted new provisions in Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS) that ensure tough penalties for crime against women, including hanging and life imprisonment. “In my mission of Viksit Bharat, the country’s women are playing an important role and hence, there is a need to further empower them. But there is also a simultaneous need to ensure theirsafety and security ,” the PM said.The event organised by Maharashtra govt honoured women under Union govt’s Lakhpati Didi scheme, which recognises self-help group (SHG) members who earn an annual household income of Rs 1 lakh or more. PM Modi handed certificates to 11 lakh new Lakhpati Didis and released a revolving fund of Rs 2,500 crore for 48 lakh SHG members. Bank loans worth Rs 5,000 crore were disbursed to benefit over 25 lakh SHG members.PM Modi said Lakhpati Didi scheme is designed to make women financially stable. “Compare the work done by opposition in 60 years and initiatives that our govt had taken in one decade. Till 2014, Centre had given bank loans to Sakhi Mandals amounting to Rs 25,000 crore. In contrast, our govt gave bank loans of Rs 9 lakh crore,” he said.“The state is playing an important role in our Viksit Bharat initiative. Mahayuti govt should remain in office for a long time. It is stable and capable of attracting investments to promote industrialisation, employment generation, and give adequate focus on education and skill development of youth,” he said.
Article Summary: PM Modi expressed his empathy for the anger and pain felt by women across the country. He warned that police, doctors, and school representatives protecting culprits should not be spared. PM Modi highlighted new provisions in Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita that ensure tough penalties for crime against women.

Article Title: BJP to Congress: Explain why your governments haven't kept OPS promise
Article Text: The BJP praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's decision to implement the UPS, emphasizing his commitment to addressing issues of central government employees. Ravi Shankar Prasad highlighted the benefits for 23 lakh employees and criticized Congress for making unfulfilled promises about the Old Pension Scheme. He questioned Congress's inconsistency and urged Rahul Gandhi to keep promises.
Article Summary: The BJP praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's decision to implement the UPS. Ravi Shankar Prasad criticized Congress for making unfulfilled promises about the Old Pension Scheme. He questioned Congress's inconsistency and urged Rahul Gandhi to keep promises.

Article Title: Congress hints at backing UPS, but takes U-turn jibe at govt
Article Text: Congress hinted at supporting UPS, with party president Mallikarjun Kharge calling govt's announcement part of a larger trend after the Lok Sabha poll results where "people's power prevailed over the arrogance of power". In sharp contract, Professionals' Congress chairman Praveen Chakravarty directly backed UPS as "prudent and welcome".Congress had omitted the mention of OPS in its LS manifesto after its defeat in three state elections in December.But manifesto panel chairman P Chidambaram had argued that the party was waiting for the central govt's committee working on revamping NPS.While Kharge's statement indicated an indirect approval of the new scheme, Chakravarty publicly supported it on X, saying UPS guarantees a minimum amount for retired families that the New Pension Scheme didn't. The statements have raised the possibility of a positive reaction from Congress states.Kharge said, "The 'U' in UPS stands for Modi govt's U turns!" He cited a series of rollbacks by govt - on long-term capital gain/indexation, the lateral entry scheme, the broadcast bill, and also govt's decision to refer the controversial Waqf Bill to a JPC. "We will keep ensuring accountability and protect 140 crore Indians from this despotic government," he said.
Article Summary: Congress had omitted the mention of OPS in its LS manifesto after its defeat in three state elections in December. Party president Mallikarjun Kharge called govt's announcement part of a larger trend. Professionals' Congress chairman Praveen Chakravarty directly backed UPS as "prudent and welcome"

Article Title: JDU slams Rahul on caste count
Article Text: Union minister and JDU leader Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh on Sunday said that "at two crucial INDIA bloc meetings in Bengaluru and Mumbai, we demanded a resolution on a caste survey but Rahul Gandhi rejected it". JDU was then part of the INDIA bloc.Lalan said the erstwhile Grand Alliance in Bihar conducted a caste survey but Rahul never appreciated the effort, reports Manoj Chaurasia.Lalan questioned Rahul's demand for a caste census in the country, saying "the person who once rejected a caste count is now repeatedly raising the issue".
Article Summary: JDU leader Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh questioned Rahul Gandhi's demand for a caste census in the country. Lalan said the erstwhile Grand Alliance in Bihar conducted a caste survey but Rahul never appreciated the effort. He said "the person who once rejected a caste count is now repeatedly raising the issue"

Article Title: TISS Mumbai student Anurag Jaiswal found dead, cops suspect liquor poisoning
Article Text: MUMBAI: A 29-year-old first-year HR management student of TISS was on Sunday found dead in the rented apartment he shared with three friends in Chembur, reports Ahmed Ali. Police suspect Anurag Jaiswal died of alcohol poisoning following a party the night before, which was attended by 125 students from the institute.Police initially suspected that ragging at the party contributed to his death, but ruled it out based on statements of students and the hotel staff.They filed an accidental death report and sent the body for a post-mortem examination.Sources said Jaiswal consumed a significant quantities of alcohol. Hotel staffers told police he drank to the point where the bartender was forced to cut him off. They said after staff refused to serve him drinks, Jaiswal began grabbing friends' glasses and drinking from them.Jaiswal's flatmates told police they returned to the flat around 3am and went to sleep. They claimed they found him unresponsive when they woke up and rushed him to a hospital where he was declared dead.
Article Summary: Police suspect Anurag Jaiswal died of alcohol poisoning following a party the night before. Hotel staffers told police he drank to the point where the bartender was forced to cut him off. Police initially suspected that ragging at the party contributed to his death.

Article Title: No Dalit in Miss India, says Rahul; statement juvenile, retorts BJP
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Union minister Kiren Rijiju on Sunday hit out at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his comment that there were no "Dalits and adivasis" in the list of contestants in the Miss India beauty pageant and said the statement was something that could only come from a "bal buddhi (juvenile)"."Now, he wants reservations in Miss India competitions, films, sports.It is not only issue of 'bal buddhi' but people who cheer him are equally responsible," Rijiju said on XAt a Samvidhan Samman Sammelan in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj to demand a caste census, Rahul on Saturday had said India can't function well without the participation of the "90%" population."I have checked the list of Miss India, which did not have any Dalit , Adivasi (tribal) or OBC women. Some will talk about cricket or Bollywood. No one will show the cobbler or plumber. Even top anchors in the media are not from the 90%," Rahul said.
Article Summary: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said there were no "Dalits and adivasis" in the list of contestants in the Miss India beauty pageant. Union minister Kiren Rijiju said the statement was something that could only come from a "bal buddhi (juvenile)"

Article Title: Job scene improving but still not as good as pre-Covid days
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The work done under the flagship rural job scheme MGNREGS in the first four months of this financial year is still 13 crore person-days higher than in the corresponding period in 2019-20, the year before the pandemic, suggesting that the employment scene is still far from normal. However, the work done till July in 2024-25 is 23 crore person-days fewer than in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal, marking an improvement this year, according to statistics provided by the Union rural development ministry .Fiscal 2019-20 is considered a normal year under MGNREGS as the employment pattern followed the predictable variables of work demand , before it was upended by the pandemic which resulted in a national lockdown and halting of the economy. It witnessed a record rise in job demand under the distress employment programme.The work done in 2020-21 shot through the roof with a record over 389 crore person-days. It came down marginally in 2021-22 at just over 363 crore, and further to around 294 crore in 2022-23. The improvement, with a dip in MGNREGS work performance, was expected as the economy opened up with rollback of the lockdown, resulting in return of workers to traditional centres of employment.The person-days generated between April-July in 2024-25 stands at 127.9 crore, as against 150.2 crore in the same month in 2023-24. In contrast, 114.8 crore person-days were recorded in 2019-20.Crucially, the 150 crore person-days mark in April-July last year was unexpectedly high as the lockdown had been rolled back over two years ago. The person-days in 2023-24 ended the downward graph, and rose to 308 crore.The budget allocation in 2024-25 is over Rs 19,000 crore less than the expenditure incurred in the scheme in 2023-24, but may be enough to feed the work demand if the present trend holds. However, civil society experts working the ground say the introduction of national mobile monitoring software for marking attendance has hurt workers and played a role in bringing down demand, as has Aadhaar-based payment system.
Article Summary: The work done till July in 2024-25 is 23 crore person-days fewer than in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal. The improvement, with a dip in MGNREGS work performance, was expected as the economy opened up with rollback of the lockdown.

Article Title: With government share at 18.5%, UPS switch to give higher pension
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Government employees switching to the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) can hope to see a significant increase in their pension, as govt's contribution is set to increase from 14% to 18.5%.A calculation done by UTI Pension fund for TOI shows that the increase will be around 19% for those who join on a monthly salary of Rs 50,000 and see an annual increase of 3% with their corpus seeing a compounded annual growth of 8% - lower than what all the three fund managers have offered (see graphic).The corpus will probably be bigger given that the calculations have not factored in dearness allowance during the period of service as also the pay commission awards. Similarly, the monthly pension payment does not factor in the impact of dearness relief, the adjustment for inflation, that govt promised to all employees who joined service from 2004 and are part of NPS.Currently, there are three pension fund managers for govt employees - SBI, LIC and UTI - offering three schemes. Since inception in April 2008, the highest return of 9.75% is offered to central govt employees by SBI pension fund, while for the state govts, LIC Pension Fund offered the highest return of 9.56% since June 2009, according to data on the NPS Trust website.Similarly, UTI Pension Fund has assumed 6% annual return on annuities, against 5.6% to over 7% currently offered by insurance companies.Under existing rules, govt employees have three investment options with the default option, used by 95% of the subscribers, allowing up to 65% investment in govt securities, 15% in equities and the remaining in corporate debt. There is also the option to invest the entire money in g-secs and a third one - Moderate Life Cycle Fund - which allows those up to 35 years to invest 50% of the corpus in equities, 30% in corporate bonds and the remaining 20% in g-secs. The allocation towards equities falls 2% annually once the subscriber turns 35 and by the time she is 55 years, 80% is invested in g-secs with the remaining 20% allowed to be split equally between equities and corporate bonds.Fund managers said that to earn 50% of the average salary for 12 months the corpus needs to be large and with the 14% contribution by govt the objective would not have been met, prompting an increase to 18.5%. Also, employee contribution has been retained at 10%. Going forward, govt may have to increase its share of the contribution in case market returns fall."UPS is good for retiring employees. But they will miss the opportunity to potentially earn even higher returns," said D Swarup, former chairman of Pension Fund Regulator and Development Authority. For most govt employees, a 50% assured return appears to be a safer bet.
Article Summary: Government employees switching to the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) can hope to see a significant increase in their pension. Govt's contribution is set to increase from 14% to 18.5%. The increase will be around 19% for those who join on a monthly salary of Rs 50,000 and see an annual increase of 3%.

Article Title: Punjab boy, 5, is youngest Asian to scale Kilimanjaro
Article Text: Five-year-old Teghbir Singh from Punjab's Ropar has become the youngest Asian to scale the 5,895-metre Mount Kilimanjaro , the highest peak in Africa, equalling the world record set by a Serbian boy who scaled the peak at the same age, reports Bharat Khanna. The team, consisting of Teghbir, his father, two guides, and two support staff, completed the climb in six days, reaching Uhuru peak - the highest point of the mountain in Tanzania - on Aug 23.They stayed in temporary tents and took Machame Route."I chanted 'Waheguru' whenever I got tired," said Teghbir who fought low oxygen levels and altitude sickness to reach the summit, where the temperature is -10 degrees Celsius. Teghbir's father said his son had been preparing for the challenge for nearly a year. He completed the Mount Everest base camp trek in April.
Article Summary: Teghbir Singh from Punjab's Ropar has become the youngest Asian to scale the 5,895-metre Mount Kilimanjaro. He equalled the world record set by a Serbian boy who scaled the peak at the same age.

Article Title: AAP to field Sunita Kejriwal as 'star campaigner' for J&K polls
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After announcing the names of candidates for seven seats it will contest in the upcoming J&K assembly polls, Aam Aadmi Party on Sunday also shared its list of 40 star campaigners for the state. In keeping with the trend seen since the Lok Sabha elections, after AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal’s name, his wife Sunita is firmly pitched at No.2 on the list of campaigners submitted for approval to the Election Commission on Saturday.One finds Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann’s name next on the list followed by former deputy CM Manish Sisodia who came out on bail earlier this month in the Delhi excise policy scam case and has since been out among people holding 'padyatras'. According to the party he will be stepping out of the Delhi more and more now for campaigning now.The list of seven seats in J&K for which candidates were announced by party general secretary (organisation) Sandeep Pathak include Pulwama, Rajpora, Devsar, Dooru, Doda, Doda West and Banihal.The list of 40 star campaigners announced later in the evening on Sunday also includes senior AAP leaders Pankaj Gupta, Rajya Sabha MPs Sanjay Singh, Sandeep Pathak, Raghav Chadha, ND Gupta and Delhi ministers Gopal Rai, Atishi, Saurabh Bhardwaj, Imran Hussain, Kailash Gehlot and former health minister Satyendar Jain.On Sunita Kejriwal continuing to stay at the top of the list of star campaigners even after Lok sabha polls as is being seen in Haryana and now in the J&K list, AAP sources say that this is strategically aimed at conveying to the people that Arvind Kejriwal is very much listening to their concerns through his wife who shares what the public feels with him when she visits him in Tihar jail. Kejriwal was arrested and is in jail in connection with a money laundering case related to the now scrapped Delhi liquor policy. The Supreme Court will be hearing his bail pleas on Sep 6.“The party feels that public feedback reflects that people see Arvind Kejriwal as the face of AAP and his wife as a star campaigner helps establish that connect which people are looking for with the Delhi CM and AAP national convenor,” sources said.Party leaders also feel that Sunita Kejriwal’s prominence on the star campaigner list is in no way a reflection on the status of other top leaders like Sisodia who, party sources say, is firmly stepping up the outreach among people since he came out on bail. On Sunday, Sisodia visited Punjab for the first time since his release from jail. He was seen offering prayers at Golden Temple with his family and visiting Wagah border along with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann.
Article Summary: Aam Aadmi Party on Sunday also shared its list of 40 star campaigners for the state. In keeping with the trend seen since the Lok Sabha elections, after AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal’s name, his wife Sunita is firmly pitched at No.2 on the list of campaigners.

Article Title: Woman tonsured in Kangaroo court in Odisha’s Jharsuguda as husband complained thrashing by her
Article Text: BHUBANESWAR/JHARSUGUDA: Police arrested four persons for allegedly conducting a kangaroo court and tonsuring a 45-year old woman as punishment and penance after her husband complained that he was slapped by her.This incident took place in Routbahal village under Laikera police station limits in Jharsuguda district on August 9. Police registered the FIR against the four on Saturday after the woman’s son, who was working in Tamilnadu returned to the village on Friday.The arrested have been identified as Mahendra Kisan, 52, husband of the woman, Nabin Ping, Satrughna Kisan and Sushant Ping.They have been booked under section 85, 74, 133, 296, 351 (2), 356 (2), 3 (5) of BNS. Section 85 in invoked, when husband or any relative subject a woman to cruelty. Other sections explain outraging modesty and physical abuse, police said.“After Mahendra complained that he was slapped by his wife, the woman was summoned by kangaroo court. The kangaroo court members decided that she be tonsured . The woman had also thrown a mutton feast for the community members as an act of penance. Then she was allowed to stay in the house,” said Jharsuguda SP Smith Parmar.Mahendra and his wife used to be indulged in quarrel frequently. “On August 8, they had a quarrel and during the scuffle, the woman’s hand accidentally touched Mahendra’s cheek, which hurt him and informed the incident to the the community members,” Parmar added. Since the kangaroo court had outcast the woman, after the penance, she had been allowed to reunite with their cast and family.All this didn’t go down well with the couple’s son although the woman had reconciled herself to villagers’ direction, punishment and then reunion. “Their son, who worked in Tamilnadu, returned home and saw his mother tonsured. He felt hurt and rushed to the police station to lodge a complaint,” police officials said.Police said further investigation is on in the case. “Our investigation so far revealed involvement of four including the husband in the case. If more people are involved, they will be caught,” said sub-divisional police officer (Jharsuguda) Uma Shankar Singh.
Article Summary: The incident took place in Routbahal village under Laikera police station limits in Jharsuguda district. Police registered the FIR against the four on Saturday after the woman’s son, who was working in Tamilnadu returned to the village on Friday.

Article Title: Candidates showcase strength to mount pressure for ticket ahead of assembly elections in Haryana
Article Text: JIND: With the assembly elections just around the corner, political candidates in Haryana are leaving no stone unturned to showcase their strength and garner support from the public. However, no political party announced ticket so far in the state but aspirants have put all their efforts to mount pressure on their top brass who are seen holding rallies assembly wise to show their strength.In a bid to demonstrate their popularity, candidates are organizing massive rallies, roadshows, and public meetings across the state. The candidates are also using innovative ways to connect with the voters, such as door-to-door campaigns, social media interactions, and community outreach programs.The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), the Indian National Congress (INC), and the Jannayak Janata Party (JJP), Indian national lokdal (INLD) and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) are among the key players in the fray, with each party trying to outdo the others in showcasing their strength.The elections are scheduled to take place on October 1, and the results will be declared on October 4. The candidates are working tirelessly to ensure a ticket in Congress as their is long queue of aspirants in every segment. There are over 2500 candidates who have applied for ticket in Congress party in Haryana.According to political analysts, the upcoming assembly elections in Haryana are poised to witness a direct contest between the Indian National Congress (INC) and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), with the latter parties lacking the requisite strength to pose a formidable challenge. In contrast to previous elections, where multiple parties were in the fray, this time around, the political landscape appears to be polarized between the two dominant players, namely the INC and the BJP, he said.On Sunday, aspirant from former union minister Birender Singh's faction, Vrinda Sharma who is seeking ticket from Jind segment held a rally at jat dharmshala in Jind district to show her strength. Moreover, Parmod Sehwag and Pardeep Gill who are considered close to former chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda's have started their paidal yatra in Jind to garner support from public to mount pressure on party high command.Dr Ajay Chaudhary who is seeking ticket from Narnaund segment of Hisar and close to Sirsa MP Kumari Selja too held a worker meeting in Jind on Sunday at Ravidass dharmshala and sought support from public. Recently, Dr Ajay Chaudhary held a rally in Narnaund to show his strength where Selja has declared his candidature and sought votes for him.Moreover, many candidates are sweating profusely in streets to show their strength and are seeking tickets.
Article Summary: The elections are scheduled to take place on October 1, and the results will be declared on October 4. There are over 2500 candidates who have applied for ticket in Congress party in Haryana. The candidates are working tirelessly to ensure a ticket as their is long queue of aspirants in every segment.
